description: go.blog: refer to the Google Cloud Platform

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.blog

https://codereview.appspot.com/10225043/diff/1/content/go-and-google-cloud-platform.article
File content/go-and-google-cloud-platform.article (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/10225043/diff/1/content/go-and-google-cloud-platform.article#newcode1
content/go-and-google-cloud-platform.article:1: Go and the Google Cloud Platform
'the' is optional -- technically no 'the' is correct

https://codereview.appspot.com/10225043/diff/1/content/go-and-google-cloud-platform.article#newcode8
content/go-and-google-cloud-platform.article:8: In 2011 we announced the [[https://developers.google.com/appengine/docs/go/overview][Go runtime for App Engine]]. Since then, we have continued to improve the Go App Engine experience, and generally improved Go support for the Google Cloud Platform. For instance, the [[http://code.google.com/p/google-api-go-client][google-api-go-client]] provides a Go interface to a range of Google's public APis, including Compute Engine, Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Drive, and many more.
'the' is optional

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=c2fd0877c296&repo=blog ***

go.blog: refer to the Google Cloud Platform

R=golang-dev
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/10225043

subject: code review 10225043: go.blog: refer to the Google Cloud Platform
